meanings.definition: To transport goods on a dray.
meanings.sent1: The workers drayed the boxes to the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The farmer drayed his crops to the market.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels drayed acorns to their nest for the winter.
meanings.sent4: She drayed her emotions carefully, not letting them spill over.
meanings.sent5: The ants drayed food back to their colony in an organized line.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I saw an old drayed in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The drayed was used for transporting goods in the past.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the drayed was a spaceship in their game.
meanings.sent4: The drayed stood as a reminder of the history of transportation.
meanings.sent5: The drayed creaked as it moved along the cobblestone streets.

meanings.definition: A vehicle used for transporting heavy loads.
meanings.sent1: The drayed was loaded with bricks for the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The drayed moved slowly under the weight of the logs.
meanings.sent3: The drayed became a makeshift stage for the impromptu performance.
meanings.sent4: The drayed trundled along, carrying the supplies for the camp.
meanings.sent5: The old drayed had seen many years of hard work on the farm.
